info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 28 at 3:24AM EST until January 28 at 5:45AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Mecklenburg County in the piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 545 AM EST. * At 324 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Northeast Charlotte, Harrisburg and University City. At 320 AM EST, the stream gauge on Mallard Creek near Pavilion Boulevard appeared to be cresting around 13.65 feet. This is minor flood stage. Low-lying areas in the Mallard Creek Greenway near Tryon Street are expected to experience flooding at this river stage. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
